qas.question: Campidanese Sardinian is a variant of what language?
What language is Sassarese closely related to?
What language family does Gallurese belong to?
What language family does Ligurian belong to?
Where is the Catalan Algherese dialect spoken?
Which language is considered to be it's only Sardinian language family?
Which language does the Campidanese Sardinian variant include?
Where are Romance, Gallurese and Sassarese also spoken?
Which languages are not considered to be related to the Italian Tuscon language?
Where is the Romance Algherese dialect spoken?

context: <a0_0>The <a4_0>Sardinian<a4_0/> language<a0_0/> is considered to be its own <b5_0>Romance language<b5_0/> family, separate not only from standard Italian but also the wider <a2_0>Italo-Dalmatian<a2_0/> family, and it includes the Campidanese Sardinian and <b6_0>Logudorese Sardinian<b6_0/> variants. However, <b8_0>Gallurese, Sassarese, and Corsican<b8_0/> are also spoken in <b7_0>Sardinia<b7_0/>, and these languages are considered closely related or derived from the <a1_0>Italian Tuscan<a1_0/> language and thus are Italo-Dalmatian languages. Furthermore, the <a3_0>Gallo-Romance<a3_0/> language of Ligurian and the Catalan Algherese dialect are also spoken in <b9_0>Sardinia<b9_0/>.
